intro: Mentha pireana, commonly known as wild mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinct minty aroma. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue to purple and appear in whorls along the stems. Mentha pireana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
